messages.subject: Re: Off Topic Message
messages.msgSnippet: Paul et al - There is hope yet! Seems a number of folks in Japan feel the same way about this beautiful old dojo. Perhaps you should send them an invitation to
messages.messageBody:
Paul et al -
There is hope yet! Seems a number of folks in Japan feel the same
way about this beautiful old dojo. Perhaps you should send them an
invitation to sign your petition...
-t
http://www5a.biglobe.ne.jp/~ichini/bbs8/572241192990081.html

messages.messageBody:
http://www.kodansha.co.jp/dojo/dojoshosi_e.html

cheg idout
-t

On Mar 6, 2007, at 5:48 PM, Paul Martin wrote:

> Dear List
>
> Please forgive me for this vaguely sword related post, and lend me
> your signatures. Also, please forgive my typos made in haste while
> trying save a truly historic dojo, they are being addressed.
>
> It is time to fight the man again. Multi million dollar Kodansha
> publishing company want to tear down Noma dojo (Tokyo) as it does
> not suit them to have a historically important dojo on their
> grounds. Before the war, Noma dojo was one of the four great dojo
> of the eastern capital. Now it is the only remaining one. It was
> the site of the last kendo competition that was attended by the
> Emperor, and the dojo of the most famous sensei of the 20th century
> Mochida Moriji sensei.
>
> Please support our opposition to tearing down such a wonderful dojo
> and memorable experience for visiting kendoka. Here is a link for
> our petition to save Noma dojo.
>
> http://www.petitiononline.com/savenoma/petition.html
>
> Best
>
> Paul
>
>
>



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Off Topic Message
messages.msgSnippet: Hey all, If you aren t a sword swinger like Paul, myself and others on this list you may not appreciate how important this site is. Please take a minute to
messages.messageBody:
Hey all,
If you aren't a sword swinger like Paul, myself and others on this
list you may not appreciate how important this site is. Please take a
minute to look it up and read the petition and if you are so inclined
please sign on. Swords swingers will love you and good karma is sure
to follow if you all help to save this dojo.
-t
and yes please share this with anyone and everyone
